info.title: Global IoT Orchestration API Endpoints
info.description: You can use this link to download the JSON file.

tags.name: Managing eSIM Profiles
tags.description: Manage Global IoT Orchestration device profiles for either Verizon (lead) or Global (local).

tags.name: Device SMS Messaging
tags.description: Send Short Message Service (SMS) messages to devices

tags.name: Device Actions
tags.description: Device management for either Verizon (lead) or Global (local) profiles.

post.description: Resume service to a device with either a lead or local profile.
Suspend all service to an eUICC device, including the lead and local profile.
Retrieve the aggregate usage for a device or a number of devices.
Retrieve the daily usage for a device, for a specified period of time, segmented by day

get.summary: Retrieve the List of Service Plans
get.description: Retrieve all of the service plans, features and carriers associated with the account specified.

200.description: Account details **Note:** The response will have placeholders. You can identify the placeholders by `"sizeKb":0` and that the record will only have `name` and `sizeKb` values.

servicePlans.name: The name of the service plan
servicePlans.code: The inventory name or system name of the service plan
servicePlans.sizeKb: The ammount of space the service plan will occupy on the Subscriber Information Module (SIM)
servicePlans.carrierServicePlanCode: The billing record ID. This can be numeric, alpha or alphanumeric

servicePlans.name: The name of the service plan
servicePlans.code: The inventory name or system name of the service plan
servicePlans.sizeKb: The ammount of space the service plan will occupy on the Subscriber Information Module (SIM)
servicePlans.carrierServicePlanCode: The billing record ID. This can be numeric, alpha or alphanumeric

servicePlans.name: The name of the service plan (placeholder example)
servicePlans.sizeKb: The ammount of space the service plan will occupy on the Subscriber Information Module (SIM)

get.description: Retrieve all of the service plans, features and carriers associated with the account specified.

200.description: Account details **Note:** The response will have placeholders. You can identify the placeholders by `"sizeKb":0` and that the record will only have `name` and `sizeKb` values.

servicePlans.name: The name of the service plan
servicePlans.code: The inventory name or system name of the service plan
servicePlans.sizeKb: The ammount of space the service plan will occupy on the Subscriber Information Module (SIM)
servicePlans.carrierServicePlanCode: The billing record ID. This can be numeric, alpha or alphanumeric

servicePlans.name: The name of the service plan
servicePlans.code: The inventory name or system name of the service plan
servicePlans.sizeKb: The ammount of space the service plan will occupy on the Subscriber Information Module (SIM)
servicePlans.carrierServicePlanCode: The billing record ID. This can be numeric, alpha or alphanumeric

servicePlans.name: The name of the service plan (placeholder example)
servicePlans.sizeKb: The ammount of space the service plan will occupy on the Subscriber Information Module (SIM)

post.description: Enable a fallback profile to be set.

requestBody.description: Set the fallback attributes to allow a fallback profile to be activated.

post.description: Activate a device with either a lead or local profile.
Enable a device lead or local profile.
Deactivate the lead or local profile. **Note:** to reactivate the profile, use the **Activate** endpoint above.

post.summary: Enable a device profile for download (Global).
post.description: Enable the Global IoT Orchestration device profile for download.
Download a Global IoT Orchestration device profile.
Delete a device profile for Global IoT Orchestration. **Note:** the profile must be deactivated first!
Sends an SMS message to one device. Messages are queued on the M2M MC Platform and sent as soon as possible, but they may be delayed due to traffic and routing considerations.

requestBody.description: SMS message to an indiividual device.

value.smsMessage: the body or text of the message itself

value.groupName: the name of the group the device is in
value.servicePlan: the service plan the device is using
value.smsMessage: the body or text of the message itself

options.description: Sends an SMS message to multiple devices on the same service plan. Messages are queued on the M2M MC Platform and sent as soon as possible, but they may be delayed due to traffic and routing considerations.

requestBody.description: SMS message to all devices on a service plan. **Note:** replace ***OPTIONS*** with ***POST***.

get.description: Retrieves queued SMS messages sent by all M2M MC devices associated with an account.

parameters.name: next
parameters.description: Continue the previous query from the pageUrl in Location Header

put.description: Starts delivery of SMS messages for the specified account.

post.description: Returns a list of sms history for a given device during a specified time frame.
Allows the profile to fetch the complete device list. This works with Verizon US and Global profiles.
Retrieve the provisioning history of a specific device or devices.

get.description: Get the status of an asynchronous request made with the Device Actions.

accountName.description: The numeric name of the account, in the format "0000123456-00001". Leading zeros must be included.

startTime.description: The start date of the time period queried as "$datetime"

endTime.description: The end date of the time period being queried as "$datetime"

earliest.description: The start date of the time period queried as "$datetime"

latest.description: The end date of the time period being queried as "$datetime"

hasMoreData.description: A flag set to indicate if there is more than one page of data returned by the query (true) or if only one page of data returned (false)

bytesUsed.description: the total data usage recorded in Bytes

key.description: The key indicates if the SMS message was to the device (MtSms) or from the device (MoSms)

value.description: The number of SMS messages found

servicePlan.example: the name of the service plan showing usage

smsUsed.description: The total number of SMS messages from and to the device

source.description: Where the collected data is being gathered from

timestamp.description: Timestamp of when the retrieved record was completed ($datetime)

accountName.description: The numeric name of the account, in the format "0000123456-00001". Leading zeros must be included.

accountNumber.description: The numeric name of the account, in the format "0000123456-00001". Leading zeros must be included.

isProvisioningAllowed.description: Flag set to indicate if account details can be edited or not. Default is "true".

carriers.description: The list of carriers with active or available profiles

features.description: The calling and data features available for the account. **Note:** for Global IoT Orchestrator, the features `eUICC Verizon as Lead` and `Global eSim Billing` will always be present.

name.example: The name of the service plan
name.description: The name of the service plan

code.example: The inventory name or system name of the service plan
code.description: The inventory name or system name of the service plan

sizeKb.example: The ammount of space the service plan will occupy on the Subscriber Information Module (SIM)
sizeKb.description: The ammount of space the service plan will occupy on the Subscriber Information Module (SIM)

carrierServicePlanCode.example: The billing record ID. This can be numeric, alpha or alphanumeric.
carrierServicePlanCode.description: The billing record ID. This can be numeric, alpha or alphanumeric.

accountName.description: The numeric name of the account, in the format "0000123456-00001". Leading zeros must be included.

deviceIdarray.description: an array of device ID values, using "kind" to describe what type of numeric ID is being used.

timeToLive.description: A period of time the message remains valid or an end date for the message. This value would be less than the 5 day default.

servicePlan.example: the name of a service plan

errorMessage.example: a brief description of the error

VZ-M2M-Token.name: VZ-M2M-Token
VZ-M2M-Token.description: M2M Session Token ([How to generate an M2M session token?]($e/Session%20Management/StartConnectivityManagementSession))
